result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel Issac Hardesty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber, release for all standard conditions. Sentence credit of 4 days were granted if imposed.
Probation may be transferred to the County of residence.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. No Contact with the victim or witnesses listed in the criminal complaint. Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
9:52 AM Defendant Samuel Issac Hardesty in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Samuel Issac Hardesty.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Court conducts a plea colloquy with defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1. 
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1. 
Court dismisses and reads in Count 2. 

Court orders the following:
6 MONTHS  Waukesha County Jail with Huber, all standard release conditions.
4 DAYS credit if revoked
STAYED for PROBATION

Term of Probation: 12 MONTHS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
 AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
 Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
 No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
 No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
 Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
 No contact with:  victim/witness listed in the criminal complaint
 Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
 DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

FINE:  $631.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Probation may be transferred to County of residence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

dated 9/30/22 from Atty Huges re: plea and sentencing

**Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on 10-03-2022: Please convert the matter to a Plea/sentencing hearing.**

Defendant to have no contact with victims A & B (EXCEPTION: 3rd party contact for the sole purpose of an insurance claim)/witnesses A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

3:19 PM Defendant Samuel Issac Hardesty appeared by zoom audio, in custody at Ozaukee County Jail.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Samuel Issac Hardesty. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marufo.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for audio conferencing. 
Ozaukee County Jail's camera is not turned on so defendant appeared by audio.
Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Ozaukee County Jail by 10/26/2022.  It will be up to the trial court if defendant will appear by zoom or in person for the next hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
NOH&CC faxed to Ozaukee Co Jail - Confirmation
Bail/bond hearing on September 29, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
